pr_title: Snapshot of APIs as of Apache NetBeans 12.0

timeline.bodyText: Looks like newly exported API from a library, right @lkishalmi?
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach

replies.bodyText: Well, originally the Gradle Project module embedded the Gradle Tooling library, but as the external Tooling API changes it's signatures as often as not it has been put to its own module, so I do not have to increase the major version of the NetBeans Gradle Project module every time Gradle make a change.
replies.author: lkishalmi

timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1211,6 +1214,13 @@ meth public abstract boolean accepts(java.lang.String)
 meth public boolean accepts(org.netbeans.modules.css.lib.api.properties.Token)
 supr org.netbeans.modules.css.lib.api.properties.TokenAcceptor
 
+CLSS public static org.netbeans.modules.css.lib.api.properties.TokenAcceptor$Urange

timeline.bodyText:
Actually it would be better to remove all the java.awt.peer.ComponentPeer getPeer() occurences (manually). I have a feeling that the method has disappeared in JDK11 and as such, when one runs the sigtest on a new JDK, it fails saying that this method is missing. That is a false alarm.
If possible, please remove all the
meth public java.awt.peer.ComponentPeer getPeer()
 anno 0 java.lang.Deprecated()

occurrences before integrating.
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -159,6 +159,8 @@ meth public java.awt.im.InputMethodRequests getInputMethodRequests()
 meth public java.awt.image.ColorModel getColorModel()
 meth public java.awt.image.VolatileImage createVolatileImage(int,int)
 meth public java.awt.image.VolatileImage createVolatileImage(int,int,java.awt.ImageCapabilities) throws java.awt.AWTException
+meth public java.awt.peer.ComponentPeer getPeer()

timeline.bodyText: Wow, this looks like an incompatible change, that sigtest forgot to report!
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:

 CLSS public org.netbeans.modules.dbschema.jdbcimpl.DBElementsCollection
 cons public init()
-fld protected static java.util.HashSet instances
+fld protected static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> instances

replies.bodyText: I have written a test and the change seems to be properly discovered. Not sure what was going on?
replies.author: JaroslavTulach

timeline.bodyText: I do remember this API change. Done by @errael, I think.

replies.bodyText: I've added this method recently (to aid Java refactoring and similar usecases while running without nb-javac).
replies.author: jlahoda

timeline.bodyText: I have opened this constants up when explicitly supporting JUnit 4.
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
